moves.2. e3: I had seen this before he wanted to play a stonewall formation
moves.3. g3 Bg7 4. c3: It appears he wants a very big stonewall
moves.4... d5: I gain some central control and I want e4 as a outpost for my knight
moves.5... O-O 6. c5: Increases his pawn chain. No developing moves so far
moves.6... b6: I look to break his chain
moves.7... Bg4 8. Be2: Finally some development but it was forced
moves.8... Bxe2 9. Nxe2: He develops his first piece that won't be captured immediately
moves.9... Na6: I look to hit the base of his pawn chain
moves.10. a3 bxc5 11. bxc5: Now there is an open b-file to play with
moves.11... Re8: I plan on hitting the d4 pawn with e5 and he can't take the b-file for a while yet
moves.13... exd4 14. exd4 Qe7: I may be a whole minor piece down but his king is in a awkward position
moves.15. Be3 Ng4: I can win a pawn here
moves.16. Qd3 Nxe3 17. Qxe3 Qxe3 18. fxe3 Rxe3: I know not to exchange when down but his Knight is pinned
moves.19. Nd2 Bxd4: Attacking the rook and now my deficit is 1
moves.20. Rb1 Rae8: Threatening to win back my lost piece + gain a two point advantage
moves.21. Nf3 Re3xe2+ 22. Kd1 Bxc5: Now I have a three pawn advantage
moves.23. Re1 Re2xe1+ 24. Nxe1: He makes my game a lot simpler
moves.24... Bxa3 25. Rb7: He looks to attack my unmoved pawns. The rook is very powerful on the seventh rank
moves.25... c5: Connected passed pawns are stronger than Isolated ones
moves.26... Bb4: If I can trade pieces I will win
moves.27. Nd3 f5: I don't mind Splitting my passed pawns If it means the ending is simpler because I will still win due to my pawn majority
moves.28. Nxb4 cxb4 29. Ra5: He looks to get rid of my d-pawn but I preferred Rb7 winning the b-pawn
moves.29... Re5: Centralizing my rook can't be bad although it does pin the d-pawn
moves.30. Kc2 h5: I also have a K-Side pawn majority to use
moves.31. Kb3 g5 32. Kxb4 h4 33. gxh4 gxh4: Now I have  a passed f-pawn that after f4 and Rf5 I can protect my d-pawn and push my f-pawn
moves.34. Kc5: ? He loses all chance of drawing
moves.34... d4+: Now he must play kb4 to trade rooks and I can Queen
moves.42. Kxf5 Qe2: I look to trap the King in a common K and Q ending I don't mind about the pawn. It will make the ending easier if its not there
Better was Kf5 which checkmates a move earlier
moves.48. Kh4 Kf5 49. Kh5 Qg5#: And there we go. An interesting game where I managed to win back a piece and win with a pawn majority
